Class Rule

java.lang.Object
Rule
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElementaryRule, TotalisticRule
public abstract class Rule extends Object
This is an abstract class for Rule Object subclasses

    • getRuleNum

      public int getRuleNum()
      Returns the current RuleNum
      Returns:
      returns the integer form of the rule number

    • getNeighborhood

      public abstract boolean[] getNeighborhood(int idx, Generation gen)
      This is an abstract method to get the neighborhood states to an index
      Parameters:
      idx - this is the index the neighborhood is to be found
      gen - this is the generation from which the states are got
      Returns:
      returns a boolean array of the states

    • evolve

      public abstract boolean evolve(boolean[] neighborhood)
      This is an abstract method to change an index under a given rule with regards to its state and those of its neighbors
      Parameters:
      neighborhood - the states of the neighborhood in a boolean array
      Returns:
      returns the boolean state which the index should have after evolution

    • ruleTableString

      public abstract String ruleTableString(char falseSymbol, char trueSymbol)
      This is an abstract method that returns a string representation of the elementary rule changes to a state
      Parameters:
      falseSymbol - this is the character to be used as the false state representation
      trueSymbol - this is the character to be used as the true state representation
      Returns:
      returns the string representation of elementary rule

    • evolve

      public Generation evolve(Generation gen)
      This method evolves a generation and generates a new Generation object with an evolved state array
      Parameters:
      gen - this is a Generation passed as an argument to be evolved
      Returns:
      this is the new Generation object that is evolved

    • getNeighborhoodByRadius

      public static boolean[] getNeighborhoodByRadius(int idx, int radius, Generation gen)
      Gets the neighborhood of a given index in the generation with a given radius e.g index of radius one [cellStates[idx-1], cellStates[idx], cellStates[idx+1]]
      Parameters:
      idx - this is the index that is the center of the neighborhood
      radius - this is the number of indices that are to be found to the left and right of the given index
      gen - this is the generation that contains the cell states
      Returns:
      returns a boolean array that contains the given index state at the center and the neighboring cell states to the left and right
